Extract:
Sustainble Development Goal - Service Ladder for Hygiene in Households:
- Basic - Availability of a handwashing facility on premises with soap and water.
- Limited - Availability of a handwashing facility on premises lacking soap and/or water.
- No Facility - No handwashing facility on premises.

In some cultures, ash, soil, sand or other materials are used as handwashing agents, but these are less effective than soap and are therefore counted as a limited service.

rows.title: Set up a handwashing station at home

title.eng: Set up a handwashing station at home

text.eng: A handwashing station is simply a set place for your household to wash their hands. All you need is a container of water (or a tap), a basin, and some soap. The station makes it easy to wash hands after tasks like using the toilet, changing a nappy, or working in soil.

rows.title: How to wash hands

text.eng:
Step 1: Wet hands with clean, running water
Step 2: Use enough soap to cover wet hands
Step 3: Scrub all surfaces of the hands – such as back of hands, between fingers and under nails. You should scrub for at least 20 seconds.
Step 4: Rinse well with clean running water
Step 5: Dry hands with a clean cloth or towel
